People that say Brady wont sue because if the phone thing....When they go to court they wont be looking at phone records, the science that debunked the wells report, or the wells report itself. They will be going after the precedent of the punishment. There were rules that already state that ball tampering is a $25,000 fine only. The NFL fined Brett Favre $50,000 for not cooperating by turning over his phone in 2010 with regards to sending nude texts. If they go after that, Brady will win. If they do sue, they will seek an immediate injunction so Brady can play week 1 up until the federal judge decides on his suspension. Only bad part about that is if the judge rules later in the season and says he should only miss 1 game or 2, he may have to serve them in December while in a playoff push rather than the start of the season.

There is a lot of misinformation floating around about the Dez Bryant contract situation.

1. The deadline is Wednesday, July 15th, at 3pm Central time. If no long-term deal is reached by then, Jerry Jones can't simply pay Dez more later this year, even if Dez chooses to sit. In other words, if Dez sits, he just loses money and hurts the team, but he won't get paid more. This is not like when Emmitt Smith held out in 1993 and got a big deal after the Cowboys started 0-2.

2. Dez cannot go to any other team. That's how the franchise tag works. I have seen this on a lot of threads elsewhere ("He would look great in a Vikings jersey" was a comment I saw yesterday). This will not happen in 2015. Dez will play for the Cowboys, or he will not play at all. Additionally, they can franchise tag him next year as well if they choose to do so, but not in 2017.

Lastly, has anyone considered what would happen if Dez chose to sit out for a couple of games and the Cowboys went 2-0? Just interested to hear your thoughts.

data.name: Flamboyant Ken Stabler belongs in Hall of Fame

data.message: Speaking as a life long Denver Broncos fan (and avid opponent of everything associated with the Oakland Raiders), there is no objective reason why Ken Stabler should not be in the pro football hall of fame.  For his era, he had the yards, the touchdowns, the wins, the playoff performances, an MVP season and a Superbowl ring.  What else does the Snake have to have to do prove his bones and get the recognition he deserves?
The Raiders were the bad boys then and winning games. Let it go NFL brass and give the Snake his rightful place.

I'm a lifelong Chiefs fan, so it's difficult for me to give the Raiders any love and I'm sure Stabler felt the same, lol. I was an impressionable teen during his tenure in Oakland and he was the guy that made the biggest impression on me. I miss his brash, in your face, riverboat gambler mentality. He was everything the Raiders represented. That whole "screw you, we're the Raiders" attitude. I always hated the Raiders, but secretly enjoyed Stabler...RIP Snake...you earned it!

Steelers fan here. Stabler deserves a call from the Hall! Cliff Branch should be in there also. Dave Dalby was a great center- taking over for Jim Otto in '75-'76. He's another Raider that no one talks about that is deserving.
All things aside, if Joe Namath can make the HOF, Ken Stabler should no doubt also be there
Epitome of the Great Raiders teams he played on...Hall of Famer on & off the field. Smelled like Jack Daniels from his late night partying in the huddle & still came up huge on gameday. I Love that!
Raiders were not. Lose to being the most exciting team of the 70's ,RIP Snake
No question, this from a Bronco fan as well.  Raiders still suck but Kenny did not (and there's a few others from the Raiders that did not suck as well).  Give the guy is due.

RIP-To the "Snake"

My final tribute and post since some didn't respond to who Kenny the Snake Stabler RB's !  They where Mark Van Eeghen and Clarence Davis- combined for over 2,000 yards rushing same year!
The Snake took the Raiders to a 13-1 regular season record in 1976 and won the Raiders first Super Bowl on January 9th, 1977! 
Reflections on how those times have changed after the victory me and my brother went steelhead fishing right after the game, drinking Jack Daniels, catching fish-doesn't happen these days, and listen to celebrate good times! My favorite Kenny quote about those days was when he recently told a good friend Cliff Branch in his playing days all you needed was a great bar and a good girl friend when he played! In today's game you have to have a good agent and a great Lawyer! Maybe that is why the Raiders used to be so good, vs now so bad!

The "Snake" had one of the quicker, deadlier releases in football and slithered about the backfield, poised for a decisive strike. 
To the Stabler family, including his 3 children, I reach out to you with my heart and say I'm sure he's in a better place. My most sincerest and heartfelt feelings I can muster to you, the Raiders organization, and the Raiders "Black Hole" fanbase. We have all lost a beautiful and unique soul today.
